theory.introduction: Comments are ignored by Python but are useful for explaining your code. The interactive shell (REPL) lets you test small pieces of code instantly.
theory.explanation: Use `#` for single-line comments. Multi-line comments can be simulated with triple quotes, although they are usually just string literals. The REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) runs Python one line at a time and is great for experimenting.
keyPoints: Triple quotes (`'''` or `"""`) can hold multi-line notes
Comments do not affect code execution
The REPL is started using `python` or `python3` in terminal

codeExamples.code:
# This is a single-line comment
print("Hi")

'''
This is a
multi-line comment
'''
print("Hello")
codeExamples.explanation: Triple quotes can be used as block comments
